messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] NBTHK October Shinsa
messages.msgSnippet: Some political turmoil was going on earlier this year at the NBTHK and my understand is that this caused people to spin their wheels, shall I say. Mr. Tanobe
messages.messageBody:
Some political turmoil was going on earlier this year at the NBTHK and my understand is that this caused people to spin their wheels, shall I say. Mr. Tanobe told us in October that all of this has been resolved and things are moving ahead once again. I've no clue if this has delayed shinsa results although I suspect it has. Early in last year several swords sent over did take a longer than usual time to clear shinsa. At that time, according to what Tanobe san told me, they were simply hit with an unusually large number of shinsa submissions. I suspect it has been a combination of such things that my have slowed things down a bit. Hopefully 2007 will see things back into a more normal mode for them.

Ron
STL
----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 15, 2007 3:37 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] NBTHK October Shinsa


I just hear they had 1000 swords in backlog, I don't know if this is
right or not, just what I heard.

Rich

>

> the October shinsa, one of which was to be part of a
> lecture at the Tampa show. A few of the others I'd
> thought to sell in Tampa.
> I assume results are out, but have not heard back.
> They running that far behind?
>
> Curran

messages.subject: NBTHK October Shinsa
messages.msgSnippet: List, I ve heard the NBTHK had a considerable number of sword and fittings submittals, and was running behind on the considerable workload. I m sure the
messages.messageBody:
List,

I've heard the NBTHK had a considerable number of
sword and fittings submittals, and was running behind
on the considerable workload.
I'm sure the holidays didn't help either.

Anyone able to confirm this? I had several pieces in
the October shinsa, one of which was to be part of a
lecture at the Tampa show. A few of the others I'd
thought to sell in Tampa.
I assume results are out, but have not heard back.
They running that far behind?

Curran
